attributes.action: Demand that better aid be provided for countries in need of clean and safe water
attributes.background: This petition is in opposition to the decisions to divert funding from aid made leaders of international development from the UK. Help secure the well being and livelihoods for some the 650 million people (10 times the British population) worldwide who live without something as vital as safe water.
attributes.additional_details:
Many NGOs such as WaterAid fear that the approach to foreign aid made by current British Secretary of State for International Development, Priti Patel, will heavily damage the support that the world's poorest people desperately have to receive. It is imperative that this is corrected the current aid work can have long term, meaningful effect.

https://www.theguardian.com/global-development-professionals-network/2016/sep/14/uk-ngos-raise-concerns-about-priti-patels-new-approach-to-foreign-aid

attributes.action: All councils and H/A should offer any new build properties to existing tenants
attributes.background: all councils and associations should offer new build properties to existing tenants who have lived in older properties for over 10 years and are up to date with the rent accounts in order for them to be able to upgrade and older properties offered to new tenants
attributes.additional_details: Social housing tenants are stuck now if you want to move it's pretty much a no go unless you have exceptional circumstances you could do mutual exchange but if you are in a older house there's little Chance as most want new builds if councils were to offer new builds to existing long term tenants it would mean that if they wanted to upgrade or move area the choice is there new tenants to be offered the older properties

attributes.action: Dedicate more funds to the development of the city of Birmingham.
attributes.background: Too much of the British economy is centered around London. To counter this I suggest dedicating funds to the improvement and expansion of the city of Birmingham as it already has a substantial population, and has the potential to become a new economic and financial hub, strengthening the economy.
attributes.additional_details: The city of San Francisco in the U.S is a major tourist attraction and financial hub, yet it is smaller than Birmingham. If the government was too attract more buisnesses to the area, build more attractions and increase the amount of tall buildings to make it appear more of a global city, then I believe we would see a similar effect. Expanding the airport to fly directly to more cities would also bolster this effect. This would generate far more revenue and give Britain a substantial 2nd city.

attributes.action: removal of traffic commissioners powers to suspend, revoke driving licences
attributes.background: when you get an offence like an TS10 and after you have paid the fixed penalty and received the points, you are called up to the traffic commissioner nearly 3 years after the fact and she decides to suspend your licence while under a high court ruling this can only happen for a maximum of 21 days.
attributes.additional_details: the traffic  has suspended licences for 22 years according to DVLA they have had letters from VOSA through the traffic commissioner to suspend a licence until the holder is 70 years of age under current law this can only be done for a maximum of 21 day through a high court ruling or 12 month through the totting up of more that 12 penalty points

attributes.action: To change the education system to ensure all students benefit
attributes.background:
What needs to be done: 
-	The amount of memorization needed to do well in the subject needs to be reduced.
-	Courses should focus more on coursework due to the stress of exams.
-	The core subjects need to be changed in order to benefit the child outside of qualification.
attributes.additional_details:
A focus on memorization leads to a bias towards students who have a good memory, but not necessarily a good understanding. The amount of information needed to memorise has recently been increased by Ofqual.

Coursework has recently been removed completely from all non-practical subjects. This increases stress drastically to the point where it may have physical effects. Many students also struggle to perform under stressful conditions which means they do not get results that reflect their ability.

attributes.action: Compensate overseas pensioners re post Brexit drop in the Pound.
attributes.background: We, pensioners aged 72 & 79 (ex RAF- now 70% disabled)  left Britain in 1991 to go and live in France. After 19 years we joined our daughter in Germany. We know about fluctations of the Pound, but enough is enough. Since the referendum we have lost around 100 E every 4 weeks and it's getting worse!
attributes.additional_details:
My husband receives a Basic Pension (85%) and attendance allowance payments 4(weekly) , I receive the married woman's part of his pension.
The first payments after  the referendum were minus 92 Euros and with each subsequent payment the minus has increased. It's shocking. I can supply details if required.

attributes.action: Prevent reverse charging on mobile phone contracts unless consent is given first
attributes.background: The current laws allow anyone with your mobile number, who sets up a business through the regulator, to charge you too "Receive" texts that cost you money without your consent.  Some of these are on the proviso that you opt-out of something you haven't even requested.
attributes.additional_details:
It should not be possible to charge you to receive texts until the user has opted-in, by responding to a text message instead of just receiving it, and mobile network operators should be forced to disable reverse charge billing if requested by the bill payer.

Mobile network operators should also be made to publish their involvement in these companies as well as the profits that they make from them as there is clearly a conflict of interest.

attributes.action: Have an annual referendum on the most signed petition to make it legally binding
attributes.background: In late 2006 the government set up the e-petitions website as a way for people to engage with politics. Millions of people have signed petitions, but we still don't feel like these petitions are given any real attention or importance. Petitions having the chance to become laws would change this.
attributes.additional_details:
The e-petitions website was created in November 2006 and the created petitions cover everything from tax to immigration, moral and ethical concerns, education, science and the very direction of the country. 

In 2015, the BBC reported "an unnamed government minister branded the site an own-goal thought up by a "prat"". 
People still don't feel the issues they are passionate about are taken seriously. We create and sign petitions because we want to see change, we want our voices to be heard.

attributes.action: We want a government run school bus system similar to America's.
attributes.background: As a student I understand the ridiculous bus prices which we have to pay to even go to school. I believe that as we have a right to education it is wrong that parents have to pay up to £12 a day For us to go school. As well as this students who ride on private coaches have to pay up to £300 a year.
attributes.additional_details:
I know a student who has three siblings going to the same school. His mother has to pay £8.85 each day just for her children to go to school. 

I believe that the American system of having government run school buses is greatly superior to our system now.

I understand like most things in this world this will cost money, my suggestion is to raise council tax by £1-3 and use that money to set up a government run bus system. There are 27 million households in the UK, meaning £81 million a month.

attributes.action: Decrease the required number of signatures for a debate by 10,000
attributes.background: With a gap of 90,000 signatures between an out-ruling response and a fair debate, there are becoming unacceptable amounts of valid opinions on law and rights shared by thousands upon thousands, which don't get a look in. Shredding this by a mere 10,000 is reasonable in context.

attributes.action: Introduce Entry Level Apprenticeships
attributes.background: We would like to initiate a scheme that allows access to entry level apprenticeships for those who may not achieve a level one qualification, Entry level apprenticeships would give these young people a future within well paid , skilled vocational jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
Many young people find school a difficult learning experience, some have the disadvantage of a learning disability, ASD, mental health issues  and or EHC plans which are not fit for purpose, as some young people's progression is slower and requires additional support. Some just have talents that are more vocational. Not everybody is naturally gifted at Maths, English and Sciences.
However, the system works to add to their disadvantages by favouring those who are more academic. It is very difficult for these young people to gain access to an apprenticeship because these require a level 1 grade,on completeion, in numeracy and literacy.

attributes.action: Stop employment agencies using incremental holiday pay as part of basic rate.
attributes.background: Recruitment agencies, particularly within the construction industry, agree a basic rate and then make that rate up of a lower basic rate up of a lower rate plus incremental holiday pay. This is common practice, but the law clearly states that holiday pay must be a "true addition" to the basic rate.

attributes.action: Raise UK Legal Limit of Stakes For Poker In Pubs To £10 & £20 In Members Clubs
attributes.background:
The gambling act 2005 states: 
Low stakes poker is permitted in pubs, with stakes kept to a maximum of £5 per player, with a £100 max pot per premises per day. 
Low stakes poker in social clubs, with the correct permit, allows a maximum of £10 per player £250 total pot per premises per day
attributes.additional_details:
We're petitioning to change this law to the following:
Low stakes poker to be permitted in pubs with stakes kept to: £10 Maximum per player with no maximum pot, in social clubs: £20 maximum per player no maximum pot (modify the gaming permit licence)
stake limits should now be raised as inflation no longer reflects the outdated limits set in the gambling act 2005 & an unrestricted maximum pot size
We believe that this change to the law would also benefit all UK pubs who are struggling to survive

attributes.action: 10 year automatic sentence for carrying a knife
attributes.background: Anyone caught carrying a knife should be given a standard 10 year jail sentence.

attributes.action: take alcohol off display in shops like cigarettes and no advertising
attributes.background:
Alcohol-related crime in the UK is estimated to cost between £8bn and £13bn per year.
A fifth (29%) of all violent incidents in 2013–14 took place in or around a pub or club. ...
attributes.additional_details: There were 8,270 casualties of drink driving accidents in the UK in 2013, including 240 fatalities and 1,100 people who suffered serious injury.

attributes.action: Introduce a new and robust system of dealing with judicial misconduct
attributes.background: The rules which govern judicial misconduct exclude any decisions made by a judge in the course of proceedings. For example, the personal decisions of judges knowingly and purposively to falsify a claim or to make misleading records in court documents are all classified as "judicial decisions".
attributes.additional_details: The rules do not distinguish between judicial case management and judicial case manipulation. Judicial misconduct is now defined as little more than rudeness.  A judicial decision is now almost any personal decision made by a judge in  court. There is no constituted body which ensures everyone's basic right to a fair and public hearing by an independent and impartial tribunal, or the right to an honest, accurate and unbiased record or that judges must be impartial and seen to be impartial.

attributes.action: The import and personal use of DMT-containing plant materials should be legal.
attributes.background: While the Psychoactive Substances Act 2016 is right to ban some dangerous legal highs, a blanket ban is ill-considered. Personal use and import of DMT-containing plant materials, in their natural form, should be legal, especially since the possession of said item is NOT a crime under this new act.
attributes.additional_details:
Certain plants and plant materials found in nature have long been used for curing depression, learning about consciousness and developing spirituality for those who find religion ineffective. Plants used for 'Ayahuasca' have powerful healing properties and have been used by many to help overcome depression, anxiety and stress. Personal use can allow people to study spirituality, the nature of our existence and consciousness as a right of their freedom.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayahuasca

attributes.action: Change The General Election Voting System From FPTP To Instant-Runoff Voting
attributes.background: Hello, I am Emmanuel and I am 13 years old and came across a video on YouTube that displayed how bad the first past the post voting system is. In its simplest form FPTP is basically winner takes all. In the general election the Conservatives won 36.9% of the votes but they have 100% of the power.
attributes.additional_details:
I want to change the the the general election voting system from FPTP to IRV because in IRV there is definitely a majority winner so most people who vote will at least be moderately happy.

This YouTube video explains how bad FPTP is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s7tWHJfhiyo

This YouTube video explains how much better IRV is: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3Y3jE3B8HsE

attributes.action: help with more funding for veterans with PTSD and family's
attributes.background: Currently change step have been denied extra funding to carry on providing a mentoring service for veterans suffering PTSD and families, by losing this much needed service, this could have a negative impact on the mental health issues of veterans,
attributes.additional_details:
Change Step, based in Colwyn Bay, Conwy county, said 29 workers would lose their jobs following an unsuccessful bid for further funding.
The charity said it was still "determined to carry on".
The Ministry of Defence, which awarded the charity £995,918 in 2013, said it could apply for further funding "in the coming months and years".

attributes.action: Remove the engine size limit on A1 motorcycle license
attributes.background:
Currently the A1 license has three limitations
* maximum 11 kW
* power-to-weight ratio not more than .1 kW
* must not be more than 125 cc
Whereas the A2 license only has two
Some motorscooters/motorcycles may have over 125cc yet still produce under 11 kW yet adhere to the power limit set by A1
attributes.additional_details:
For example, these currently sold vehicles:

Piaggio Vespa PX150
LML Star 151
LML Star 200 

adhere to the power-to-weight ratio and kW limitations of the A1 license.  Changing the A1 criteria to remove the engine size limit brings it in-line with the A2 license (which is also without engine size limit) and gives a further incentive to pass the A1 test rather than ride on a L-plate under a CBT thus improving road safety

attributes.action: Introduce a "safe for the road" certification system for both riders and horses.
attributes.background: Horses are large animals and potentially dangerous on the roads, especially  to pedestrians and cyclists. The level of rider skill, and the temperament of the animals is enormously varied. Most horse riders are able and considerate but a significant minority are not.

attributes.action: Co-ordinate a crowdfund of Tata Steel interests in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is in danger of losing it's Steel industry due to the commercial viability for it's owners, Tata Steel. It is my petition that the UK government negotiate a scrap/asset disposal price from Tata, prepare a crowd-funding campaign for the acquisition and management of these assets.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, the crowdfunding campaign should look to raise sufficient additional funds to give a minimum 2 year safety net for the continuation of the business based upon projected revenue streams. For more information on how to support the campaign further please get your friends, employer and any wealthy individuals that you are connected with to visit myopinionpal.com where any funds raised will be used to get more people to support this petition.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Make retesting of all road users compulsory every 5 years to ensure road safety.
attributes.background: With road deaths increased in 2014 by 4% from 2013 to 1775, serious road injuries increasing by 5% in 2014 from 2013 to 22807 and the total of 194,477 casualties of all severities in reported road traffic accidents during 2014 retesting of road users is essential to protecting the roads.
attributes.additional_details: http://tinyurl.com/nkzmbzh shows the evidence. What is proposed is that road users be charged for the retest. If they pass the test they are refunded the entire test fee as they are competent, if they fail they revert to a provisional licence and have to retrain similar to learners. This makes roads safer (priority), increases employment within the DVSA (better for workforce), provides additional income source which can be put on improving the road network in the UK. Winners all round.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of non-rescue cats and dogs In pet stores.
attributes.background:
San Francisco enacted a new law stating that pet shops can only sell cats and dogs that come from rescue centres.

Let's follow in their footsteps to ensure that rescued animals find a home before dogs and cats are needlessly bred for profit!
attributes.additional_details:
In 2015, the RSPCA alone rescued and collected 118,994 animals. In the same year, 5,142 had to be put down because of overcrowding in shelters and lack of resources. 

We, the people of the UK, request a law that will ensure that pet stores will help find homes for the hundreds of thousands of dogs and cats left to be forgotten BEFORE breeding more!

http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsround/39004663

http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/609353/The-Dogs-Trust-stray-dog-crisis-in-UK

attributes.action: Students to have over an hour and a half of Physical Education a week
attributes.background: Make it a legal requirement that students have to have over an hour and a half of physical education per week.

attributes.action: Conduct a full review into Business Rates to make them fairer to small business.
attributes.background: The upcoming revaluation of business rates will result in crippling increases to some small businesses already struggling to compete with online retailers. We call upon the government to postpone the revaluation until a full review has been carried out and the sytem made fairer to small business.

attributes.action: When the UK leaves the EU British passports should have pink covers.
attributes.background: Leaving the EU is all about taking back control and making Britain great again. Let's set our sights high and, remembering the pink all across the globe just 100 years ago, let's have our British passports proudly clad in pink!

attributes.action: Abolish naturalisation fees for any EU migrant who exercises EU treaty rights
attributes.background: Estimated 2.9 million people from EU live in the UK at the moment and contribute to the culture and the economy of UK. It's estimated that "the net fiscal contribution of migrants from the ten central and eastern European countries that joined the EU in 2004 or 2007 was almost £5 billion".
attributes.additional_details: We do contribute to the culture and enrich tradition in this multicultural country. In full respect to the law which allows EU members to stay in the UK, we'd like to ask for the fees to be abolished as a recognition for the contributions we made to the society.

attributes.action: Make employers pay a minimum of 6 Month full maternity pay to employees.
attributes.background: It should be compulsory for companies to pay an employee that has been with a company for at least a year their full monthly wage. Too many companies are not offering any benefits to new mothers putting the burden on the government system to pay this amount.
attributes.additional_details: It is impossible for a woman to live on an average of £112 weekly from the government, with rent or mortgage, bills, food shopping and a new baby to take care off its questionable as to how she would survive without going back to work almost immediately after giving birth or alternatively having to quit work to receive far better benefits from the government this would certainly put more pressure on the government  but If full pay for 6 was made compulsory it would save on government resources.

attributes.action: Ban the Operation of one person operated Trains (I.e. without a Guard/Conductor)
attributes.background:
There is currently a dispute between railway unions and operators over the proposal to operate trains single manned (without a guard/conductor)
This practice is not safe for the public, if a fight or assault happens there is no one to call on, likewise if there is a problem when departing a station
attributes.additional_details:
Trains have had a Guard and Ticket Inspector for many years, the reason for this has been one of safety and general public well being. Many incidents and disputes happen on public transport and the public need someone to oversee this and someone to call upon for help.
Would you hold a major league football match with only one security guard?
Or an airplane with only the captain?
Then why do this to our trains? It is a security risk. Please ban the practice and help settle the dispute.

attributes.action: Dual train (mental health and physical health) paramedics and nurses
attributes.background: Any individual who is training to become a paramedic or nurse does not have to have any mental health training. With more and more people developing mental health issues, all medical professionals; especially frontline ones, should have mental health training alongside their medical training.
attributes.additional_details: The problem is evident all over the country; more people who are in a mental health crisis or who have a history of mental health issues are calling 999, paramedics are sent to these individuals but because they are not usually physically unwell they are either assessed and left, or taken to hospital, where A&E doctors evaluate their physical health and once that is given the OK they are sent home, with no intervention from mental health services and usually the cycle starts again...

attributes.action: Prevent the rise in tuition fees under the TEF for university students
attributes.background: The TEF is the teaching excellence framework, an idea which in itself is not necessarily negative and will attempt to bring universities to a similar standard however the rise in fees associated with the cash incentives, some universities would see a steady increase in already climbing tuition fees.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.savethestudent.org/news/whats-the-deal-with-the-tef.html

attributes.action: Scrap Stamp Duty
attributes.background:
Stamp duty makes it very difficult to buy a first home or even move home. 
The govement have schemes to help people get on the property ladder but then tax you if you do actually buy a home.

attributes.action: Make Personal Finances a core subject in education throughout the United Kingdom
attributes.background: Make personal finance a core subject through educat. This subject would cover interest rates on various bank accounts and the benefits for each. The subject would also inform students the risks of loans and credit cards and the correct way to keep a positive credit score.
attributes.additional_details: Students are leaving school without knowledge on personal finances and how best to manage their funds. General knowledge on council tax, mortgage rates and many more essential finance information is never taught, and therefore left to learn themselves over their young adulthood. Misinformation regarding loans and credit cards can cripple a young adults future credit scores, therefore effecting them for major life decisions.

attributes.action: Anyone fly-tipping should lose their driving licence and have vehicle crushed
attributes.background: We live in a beautiful country and it's disgraceful to see people getting away with fly-tipping. Instead of fines if there is evidence from the public filming the offence then crush the offending vehicle and ensure the driver is banned from driving, and give them a community order to clear rubbish.

attributes.action: Government has to replace EU funding for rare diseases
attributes.background: There are over 6000 rare diseases that Rare Disease Day recognise that need ongoing research and funding. By leaving the EU I wish to ensure that the funding remains in place. My son has PVNS which needs continued funding.
attributes.additional_details: http://ec.europa.eu/research/health/pdf/ri_projects_factsheet.pdf#view=fit&pagemode=none

attributes.action: Do not bring 3,000 refugee children into the UK.
attributes.background: These children are currently in a safe country, their needs should be met by that country.  It sends out the wrong message and encourages unscrupulous economic migrants/refugees to send unaccompanied and vulnerable children to Europe so they can follow after them.

attributes.action: Back the British Pound with gold and / or silver.
attributes.background:
Many people are alarmed at the voracious rate of money printing or QE here in the UK (& elsewhere). This is nothing more than a ponzi scheme & this one will end in disaster soon.
We need to get ahead of the game & back our currency with gold/silver before others steal the lead on this.
attributes.additional_details:
Web. www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Web. www.sprott.com
Book. When Money Dies. Adam Ferguson.
Book. The Silver Manifesto. David Morgan.
Book. The Big Reset. Willem Middelkoop
Organisation. GATA (Gold Anti Trust Action Committee)

attributes.action: Create ban for 5.5+ tonne lorries using the outside lane on dual lane motorways
attributes.background: Create enforceable ban on lorries 5.5 tonnes and over using the outside lane on dual lane motorways, to be especially strict during heavy commuting hours. It causes a huge risk to public safety with exaggerated accordion effects and shunt crashes due to high closing speeds. Also slows down traffic!
attributes.additional_details: The M42 is a good example. Between the M6 at Birmingham and the M1 south, lorries pull out whenever they please causing massive queues and shunt crashes during 'rush hour' times. This needs to stop!

attributes.action: S106 money for sport equally divided; mens, womans and childrens involvement.
attributes.background: Funding for sport through Section 106 can disproportionately advance male dominated sports and not benefit the whole community. This money should be used to support women and children to access sports also and any money used must show how it can equally support sport for all.

attributes.action: Change lottery back to £1 and 49 balls also the operator Camelot has ruined it
attributes.background: Since lottery was changed your chances of winning are 45 million to 1 rather 14 million to 1 also  the doubling off the price and cutting the amount off 20,000 raffles down from 50 off  to 20 off and the prize fund needs look at example when you got 5 numbers and only got £15 and 3 numbers got £25
attributes.additional_details:
The odds of winning the lottery with 59 numbers
 the new rules, the pool of numbers for players to choose from will increase from 49 to 59. At the moment, players choose six numbers up to 49, with odds of winning the jackpot sitting at just under one in 14 million. These will lengthen to around one in 45 million from Saturday
Punters with five winning numbers in Wednesday's Lotto draw ended up with just £15.

attributes.action: Eliminate higher rate stamp duty for small developers restoring  old properties
attributes.background: Currently buying and restoring an unihabitable Victorian house previously owned by elderly people who did not look after it. Will then sell it as an updated habitable property. Would pay stamp duty anyway as well as vat on costs of restoring and tax on completion. Higher rate sdlt too much.
attributes.additional_details: Higher rate stamp duty is an unnecessary tax preventing developers updating and restoring homes. Can make the process unviable. We will end up having derelict properties dotted around our towns and cities which could be homes.

attributes.action: Debate in parliament, the reduction in Foreign aid Budget.
attributes.background:
I have extensive experience within The Community Care Environment and am appalled by the parlous state in our Country at the moment.

We deliver foreign aid in billions-some of which is squandered-and we need to address our domestic health problems before we deliver this largesse to abroad.
attributes.additional_details:
Extensive knowledge of Social Care-previous Domiciliary Care provider to Suffolk County Council, and on board of Charities.

Evidence is clearly provided of our Health and Social Care meltdown, by looking in Communities, witnessing at close hand the downward-spiralling standards, to which we are subjecting our population, children, men and women

attributes.action: Stop the NHS defunding IVF Treatment and make it equal no matter where you live
attributes.background: The NHS is planning to look at cutting funding to IVF treatments. This is while still allowing people to have cosmetic treatments like tattoo removal for free. People who meet the criteria and have followed guidelines deserve to have this treatment no matter where they live. Stop postcode lottery.

attributes.action: Make Social Services & Cafcas accountable & transparent by using audio recording
attributes.background: Social Services & Cafcas get it wrong too much. Innocent families have children removed and families needing intervention go ignored. Errors are made in the reports and systems. Interviews not accurately relayed and misinterpreted. They need to be held to account and interviews audio recorded.
attributes.additional_details: Social Services fabricated evidence in my social chronology, misinterpreted information and made duplicate entries without changing dates so it's obvious the errors. Biased opinions are relied on and facts and evidence presented ignored so we are unable to address these. Complaints are passed to nhs and back to Ss. Theses incorrect opinions and documents are relied on. Making complaints is used against us. Cafcas & Social Services also record opinions and misconstrue interview content.

attributes.action: Taxes paid by EU Citizens to be returned if they're not granted right to stay
attributes.background: As EU citizens living and working in the UK we have made a conscious decision to invest in this country and our futures. If we are not granted permanent residence all our tax contributions should be returned, as we will no longer be able to enjoy the fruits of our labour and love.
attributes.additional_details: There can be no denying the positive impact EU citizens have made to the UK economy. However, we are facing the prospect of having to start new lives, leave friends, families, lovers, careers and future plans behind. To return all the investment we have made towards the prosperity of this country, would be just a small gesture, like a dream holiday booking cancellation, where the provider could no longer fulfill the Terms and Conditions.

attributes.action: Reduce the UK Foreign aid budget to 0.3 per cent of our national wealth
attributes.background:
The £3.5bn extra in England by 2020, not enough.  Similar amount  cut from SC budgets since 2010.  Extra would not solve the longer term problems of caring for a population which is continuing to age.

NHS England funding crisis deepens, with trusts forecasting a £2.3bn deficit by end of the FY.
attributes.additional_details:
More than half trust finance directors (53%) believe care provided is deteriorating.  Most trusts fear they will not be able to meet nationally imposed caps on spending. 9/10 hospitals and 2/3 health trusts  forecasting deficits.  2/3 trusts now reliant on reserves extra help from DOH
1/11 patients waited 4 hours+ worst since 2003.  BMS head “Its clear government is managing the NHS into greater deficit by cutting resources & expecting service improvements at a time of rising demand.”

attributes.action: Allow and train our prison officers to use PAVA spray and tasers
attributes.background: Prison officers are faced with violent incidents on a day to day basis. These can include weapons being used by some of the mode violent people in the country. Our officers are expected to be able to deal with these situations by using nothing more than control and restraint techniques. Times change

attributes.action: For the PM to notify the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25 March 2017
attributes.background: The people of the UK voted on 23rd June 2017 to leave the EU. The bill to withdraw is currently passing through Parliament. Once passed, it would be fitting for the Prime Minister to notify, under Article 50(2) of the Treaty on EU, the UK’s intention to withdraw from the EU on 25th March 2017.
